name: the mountain throw
notes:
free pattern available on the blog through the link here on ravelry, or there is a [paid, printable version available on etsy here][1].

inspired by colorful mountain landscapes, the mountain throw brings gorgeous, woodsy warmth to any space. using a repetitive stitch pattern, you’ll create a lovely light blanket perfect for everyday use. watch the varied tweed colors emerge without ever having to make a color change thanks to the self striping yarn. this blanket is soft and not “holey”. have fun customizing your colors for your space – there are so many beautiful options!

materials:
2 (3) lion brand yarn ferris wheel in summer day (kit here)
1 (2) lion brand yarn ferris wheel in buttercup
1 (2) lion brand yarn ferris wheel in imaginary garden
1 (2) lion brand yarn ferris wheel in pink marmalade
each skein contains 270 yds & 85 g
pattern uses approximately 425 g (765 g)
us size h 5.0 mm crochet hook
scissors
tapestry needle to weave in ends

size (approximate):

follow directions throughout pattern for the size you are making. the smaller size is listed first, followed by the larger size.

s (l)
lapghan: 50” x 28”
throw blanket size:50" x 51"


  [1]: https://www.etsy.com/listing/1601159345/the-mountain-throw-colorful-crochet
